title.narrative: F.a: Building and strengthening unions in Mozambique corridors and hubs

description.narrative: This project will strengthen the transport sector unions through training, trade union education, recruitment and union collaboration in Mozambique. The project will put focus on road, rail and port sectors and industries. The privatization and globalizat ion of transport sector services are advancing and affecting in multiple ways in the road, rail and port industries. Consequently, the service entities are fragmented, their quality is weakened, less labor force is required, more outsourced work appears, u nion work is hampered and undermined, salaries and working conditions are weakened. Union’s improved capacity to understand, react and advocate on the anti-privatization and on its effects, will be out most important as well as the transport union’s co llaboration. The project will increase the awareness of the transport sector workers on basic union and labor rights and will enhance union memberships through training on recruitment skills, campaigning skills, negotiation skills, and through research. T hrough joint planning and increased union interaction, the union cooperation will strengthen. Communication materials are developed, and the radio and TV will be equipped to maximize the media coverage. Through the research mapping, the main target compani es will be determined. While the union resources will increase, the collective agreement processes will multiply. At early stages, the main beneficiaries are the newly trained union activists and leaders. Thus, the unions that are engaged, will also benef it through increased membership and trainings. As the union capacities and their cooperation will increase, and the collective agreement processes increase, the ultimate beneficiaries will be the transport sector workers and their families. This project is executed by International Transport Federation (ITF) and implemented by ITF’s affiliated unions in Mozambique.
